title: Track Your Hearing
description:
Altersbedingter Hörverlust (Presbyakusis) ensteht durch alters- und lärmbedingte Veränderungen im Innenohr und in der Hörrinde des Gehirns. Bei vielen Menschen entsteht Presbyakusis schon im Alter von ca. 40-50 Jahren und nimmt über das Alter hinweg stetig zu. Bereits ungefähr 50% der über 80-Jährigen unserer Bevölkerung werden mit mindestens einer leichten Form von Presbyakusis diagnostiziert. Oft führt dies dazu, dass die Betroffenen Schwierigkeiten haben, einem Gespräch zu folgen und das Gegenüber zu verstehen. Besonders in Situationen mit vielen Nebengeräuschen wie zum Beispiel in einem Restaurant oder am Bahnhof oder wenn das Gegenüber undeutlich spricht, wird das Verstehen von Sprache umso anstrengender und teilweise fast unmöglich. Oft berichten betroffene Personen, dass sie durch die Anstrengung schnell ermüden und beispielsweise Mühe haben, die lauten Nebengeräusche auszublenden und sich nur auf das Gegenüber zu konzentrieren. 
Die Folgen von Hörverlust schwanken also stark je nach Situation, in der man sich befindet (z.B. im lauten Restaurant oder in einer sehr ruhigen Umgebung) und beeinträchtigen über den Tag hinweg mal stärker und mal schwächer. Weitere Gründe für Schwankungen können aber auch die Tageszeit, die aktuelle Tätigkeit, die aktuelle Stressempfindung und vieles mehr sein. Viele Menschen können eine gute Einschätzung dieser Schwankungen abgeben und den Zeitverlauf aus dem Gedächtnis rekonstruieren - eine exakte Messung dieser Schwankungen ist damit aber nicht gegeben. Eine systematische Erfassung des Hörverlusts und ihrer Schwankungen im Einfluss auf das Sprachverstehen über mehrere Wochen war bislang noch nicht möglich.
Mit diesem Forschungsprojekt wollen wir eine Möglichkeit bieten, die individuellen Schwankungen des Hörvermögens mittels einer Smartphone-App zu erfassen. Mit Hilfe Ihres Smartphones können Sie die Schwankungen Ihres Hörvermögens und deren Folgen systematisch messen und herausfinden, wie diese mit Ihrem Tagesablauf und Ihren Aktivitäten zusammenhängen. Über die Internetseite können Sie den Verlauf Ihrer eigenen Daten einsehen und gegebenenfalls mit Ihrem behandelnden Arzt oder Therapeuten besprechen.
Mit Ihrer Teilnahme unterstützen Sie unser Forschungsprojekt, die Schwankungen des Hörvermögens, dessen Ursachen und Wirkung besser zu verstehen.


Über das Team

TrackYourHearing wurde von der Tinnitus Research Initiative (TRI), dem Institut für Datenbanken und Informationssysteme (DBIS) der Universität Ulm und der Forschungsgruppe Neuroplastizitäts- und Lernforschung des gesunden Alterns (HAB LAB) der Universität Zürich entwickelt. Das Team besteht aus: 
M. Sc. Johannes Schobel (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
B. Sc. Robin Kraft (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
B. Sc. Robin Zöller (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
M. Sc. Tim Mohring (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
Dipl. Inf. Jochen Herrmann (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
Prof. Martin Meyer (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
Dr. des. Nathalie Giroud (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
M. Sc. Patrick Neff (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
M. Sc. Ira Kurthen (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
M. Sc. Laura Jagoda (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
M. Sc. Pia Neuschwander (HAB LAB, Universität Zürich)
Prof. Dr. Manfred Reichert (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
Rüdiger Pryss (DBIS, Universität Ulm)
Dr. Winfried Schlee (Tinnitus Research Initiative)

Wenn Sie Fragen, Feedback oder Anregungen zu dem Projekt haben, kontaktieren Sie uns bitte unter info@trackyourhearing.org.

title: Hearing Booster Aid
description:
★★★This is a must app for people with hearing disabilities!★★★

Super Hearing aid app amplifies sound from the microphone straight to your headphones or earphones to give enhanced and crystal like hearing and In this Hearing aid app, We are giving you Two Hearing Amplifiers and One Hearing Music Player. You can increase amplification gain to make your music or sound from the microphone louder without distorting its amplitude and reducing its hissing noise. Whats More, this app as an enhancing tool for hearing impaired can be helpful in communication, education and entertainment...


■ Please Note:
-----------------------------------------------------

Super Hearing aid app is working properly with earphones and Audio latency depends on the model of your device and firmware version. Please Use Earphones otherwise it will cause plenty of echoes !


■ Hearing App Features ?
-----------------------------------------------------

★Two Hearing Aid algorithms.
★Hearing Music Player.
★One Tap to Boost All Volumes.
★Special algorithm to eliminate noise.
★Easy to use - no special devices, no battery replacements
★Provides the best sound quality with Automatic sampling rate selection.
★Full gain up to 30 dB with a standard headset;
★Minimum signal processing delay - just 100 ms



■ How to use this app ?
-----------------------------------------------------

1. Take your earphones and plug into the phone, make sure: you don’t hold your phone very close to the earphones, you don’t hear the feedback loop
2. Place the earphones into your ears.
3. Start raising media volume level and raise the amplify level next.



■ How Does Hearing Aid app work ?
-----------------------------------------------------
it amplifies sound from the microphone straight to your headphones to give enhanced hearing and reduce the noise


■ FAQ
-----------------------------
Q: How to eliminate echo to zero ?
A: Put mobile phone far away from you and use quality earphone.


■ Advertising Policy Disclosure:
-----------------------------
We love creating apps, and want to keep them free forever.
In order to keep our development running, Super Hearing Aid is ad-supported to generate some revenue.
Thank you for understanding.

■ Disclaimer:
-----------------------------
Super Hearing Aid app is not approved as a medical device or software and cannot be used as a hearing aid with doctor`s prescription. This app makes sounds very loud. Use common sense and caution. When you download and install this software, you agree that you are going to use this application on your own risk. In no event shall developer be liable for any damages.

title: hi Hearing
description:
The hi Hearing app alows you to use your smart phone to adjust your hi HealthInnovations® hi BTE® wireless hearing aids, enhancing your hearing experience in various listening environments.

Use the hi Hearing app to:
•       Adjust volume setings on your hearing aids
•       Choose between diferent programs
•       Pair your hearing aids to the Companion Microphone
•       Control volume input on the Companion Microphone
•       Access user guides, tutorials, hearing health videos and other resources
•       Contact the hi HealthInnovations customer care team

Be sure to familiarize yourself with the easy-to-use hi Hearing app so that you can get the most venefit from your hi BTE wireless hearing aids and share in life's special moments.  For additional resources, tools, and personalized help, our customer care team offers nationwide support in person, by phone or online.  Call hi HealthInnovations at 855-523-9355 to learn more.

comments: Back to not working on Moto G Power. App shows instruments paired, but won't connect and I don't have time to reboot every time. I can disconnect, but upon trying to reconnect, the app can't find it.

The app worked fine on my LG G6 for about a month then it would not connect to my hearing aids.  I tried deleting and reinstalling the app but still no luck.  Also, why does the app need location services enabled?  All it needs to do is connect to my hearing aids so what does my location have to do with that?  UPDATE:  The app was not working due to location services being disabled.  Now it works with new batteries but once they are a few days old it won't connect.

App works on my Nexus 7 tablet but sometimes aids won't connect. Can't use app on Samsung Luna phone cuz there are no connect buttons visible on screen. Today I discovered that double tapping left side of screen connected my left aid, and on right side it connected right aid. Eureka!Both devices run Android 6.0.1. Once connected, controls work. I wish it would remember whether I'm adjusting both aids or one until I change it.

I like the hearing aids and they work well . But i think they should develop a better app with more user control. I would like to contol tones and other options. In other words I would like full control over my hearing aids instead of driving 100 miles to have them adjusted.
At first I was unable to get the right hearing aid to connect and was told there was a known android problem. So I uninstalled and reinstalled and now they both connect for some unknown reason.

title: Philips HearLink
description:
With the Philips HearLink app you can easily and discreetly control your wireless Philips HearLink hearing aids. 

The mobile device becomes your remote control for changing listening programs, adjusting the volume, muting your hearing aids and activating streaming options. Here are some other helpful app functionalities: 

- Select from which of your TV-Adapters you want to stream the signal to your hearing aids. 
- Check your hearing aid battery level or the connection status from your mobile device to your hearing aids. 
- With the "Find my hearing aids" function, you can track the location of your hearing aids. 
- Connect your hearing aids to other devices and web services via IFTTT.

The Philips HearLink app is compatible with all Philips HearLink wireless hearing aids.  

The app is not compatible with the following Philips HearLink models: IIC, CIC, ITC. 

We hope that you will like the changes. Thank you for using our app! 

We recommend the following devices with Android 8.0 or later. 
Samsung

comments: Does not work with older android or apple systems. I had to replace a 1 year old aid. This app on my older Apple or Android phones won't register the new hearing aid. Phillip's reply that I should check their compatability list is no help. My ipad pro is listed as compatible, but detects and connects to one hearing aid, the same issue as my other devices. The older aids connected. The new one does not.

Doesn't work on Samsung. Not happy. Should have no star. It even warns you before you install that it's a low reputation app. Update: do not buy Philips. Zero stars. Update still sucks. I was in contact with Philips for 2 months... they finally gave up. Lmao Do not buy Philips. I've been robbed. Update: still sucks. Update... DO NOT BUY!!!
Connecting is hit or miss on andriod. I just got a replacement hearing aid. Now it won't link at all. Downloaded latest version of this program. No better.
Great service, easy to use and maintain. I didn't know I was missing so much. I keep asking myself why didn't l do this sooner so my wife couldn't say I told you so.

This app is great for adjusting the volume, BUT it does not have a way to quit the app, keeping it running constantly on the Android. In fact, when my hearing aids are removed, batteries out, it still reports the hearing aid. When it is wrong (says an aid is disconnected), you have to restart your phone because the app doesn't refresh. Needs improvement. Doesn't appear to have a way to email the developers.

title: RemoteLink
description:
The RemoteLink app enables you to control your hearing aids, choose what you want to hear, and adjust the sound.

The app offers a “Find my hearing aid” search feature, links to user instructions, and low battery notification.

Other features:
- Select from which of your TV-Adapters you want to stream the signal to your hearing aids

comments: I was able to connect both of my ears but after loading this new version of Remote Link I can not get to my ears. It just goes into a cycle trying to connect with no success. Is it possible to go back to the previous level of this product. It was working fine for me? I am currently having problems again. One hearing aid connects and the the product indicates that it is waiting on the other aid. This is very annoying. The original program worked fine until it was updated. 5/29/20.

I am using the android. This app does not sync consistently. When it finally does sync with the hearing aids, the connection is sporatic at best. I have had my hearing aids for 3 weeks and have been told Remotelink is the only app that is authorized with these hearing aids. It is a waste of time to use this app. It is a shame that I cannot access the full function of the hearing aids through the app. There are times when I want to increase the volume and times I want to decrease it. Not everyone can do the iphone.

For no reason, the hearing aids get "disconnected". Attempts to reconnect fail, despite turning aids on/off (several times). Also, "find my hearing aids" option is complete nonsense: It indicates that aids are about 1 mile away when they are on my person! The app worked for a while, right after downloading, but has failed for the last 3 days. Good thing this app is free. You get what you pay for.

Works Well. I have the Costco Burnafon aids and my phone is a Moto E5 Play with Android 8.0. The app connected to my aids without issue. I woukd like the ability to turn the app completey off to save my phone battery. So I force it to stop via the app manager. When it starts up it finds and connects to my aids right away. I wouldnt call this a feature rich app, but it does control volume in each aid or both and switch programs. The locate function is silly.

This app is awful, it sucks for my Android phone. I'm constantly having to restart it after reconnecting my hearing aids 1 or 2 days, 3 days if I'm lucky, then if that doesn't work I have to completely restart my phone. Are you ever going to develop a way for this app to work with Android phones?? Not everyone has an iPhone!! It pisses me off that I have to, restart the app because it isn't compatible with Android phones every single day!! If I could find another app that would work I'd use it.

comments: doesnt work only thing it does is to try snd sell me a stair lift

Well, it SORT OF works, I guess. I really wouldn't know, because I HAVE NO CLUE as to how some of the controls work. I mean, sure I understand "Left/Right Ear Volumes," and, of course "Phone Volume." I am glad to have known about 1 more control, which was "dB Gain." It is really just about the same as the other volumes except that it has a real unit of measurement, the Decibel (dB). A whisper is about 30, while 50-60 is a normal, relaxed conversation. A jackhammer or a power saw is about 100-110, and Rock concerts, jet engines, and shotgun blasts can all be between 120-145. And, believe it or not, the loudest sound any human is likely to hear (and live to talk about it) is a Humpback Whale at a (very likely) permanently damaging 168 decibels! And if you are unlucky enough to hear that under the water where sound actually travels 5 times faster than it does through the air, you may well never hear anything again. And if do end up hearing anything but a loud hiss for the rest of your life, it would qualify for being a miracle.   WOW, did I go off-subject. Sorry. Things like that are just so awesome to me. So, yeah I would like to know what those other controls do, exactly, and what they mean, or are for. It is easy to forget that if you are in some line of work where you pretty much have your own language, it is important to remember that not everyone can understand what all this stuff means.

title: Connexx Smart Connect
description:
Turn your mobile device into a Smart Connect control center: The Connexx Smart Connect App allows you to control your Smart Connect & hearing aids and how they interact with all of your favorite audio devices. Whether it is watching TV, listening to music or talking on a Bluetooth phone – control is easy and discreet via the Smart Connect App.

The app will only provide all the functions when used with a Smart Connect streaming accessory and configured by your hearing health specialist.

App features:
• Manually control the focus direction of the hearing aid microphones. (PL 80 & 60, TL 16 & 12)
• Connect audio sources quickly and easily.
• Battery status of your hearing aids and Smart Connect is clearly displayed.
• Change hearing programs without the need to touch your Smart Connect.
• Change the volume easily and discreetly.
• Adjust bass & treble to balance the quality of sound.
• Easily manage the volume of your tinnitus program.

Intended use:
The Smart Connect App is a tool whereby the patient can adjust convenience functions of a hearing aid, within a framework given by a hearing health specialist, e.g., ENT doctor, audiologist or acoustician.

Device compatibility:
The Smart Connect App is compatible with any Android device running Android 4.0 or higher public release. 

Hearing aid compatibility:
The Smart Connect App is only compatible with the latest generation of Rexton 6c & 4c [80 / 60 / 40] and Audio Service G4 & G3 [16 / 12 / 8] hearing aids.

Smart Connect and Smart Connect App:
The Smart Connect App fully supports the Smart Connect and its audio streaming capabilities. If Smart Connect is not present, access to the most basic features is available by acoustic operation.

Control signals:
The Smart Connect App generates short control signals when used in Smart Remote mode which may be audible. 

To ensure correct operation and for safety reasons: 
1. While using the app do not hold the loudspeaker of this device to your ears or the ears of others. 
2. While using the app do not use the device with headphones, headsets or other audio playback devices.

PLEASE CAREFULLY READ THE MANUAL OF THE HEARING AIDS BEFORE USING THIS APP.

The Bluetooth word mark and logos are owned by the Bluetooth SIG, Inc., and any use of such marks by Sivantos GmbH is under licenses. Other trademarks and trade names are those of their respective owners.

title: Smart AMP
description:
[WARNING !]
If you use a sound amplifier without a doctor's prescription, your hearing can get worse.
Be sure to plug-in your earphone or pair your bluetooth headset with your mobile phone before starting the app.

If It’s less than 48 hours since you bought an app, you can request a refund through Google Play.
A refund is not possible 48 hours after purchasing an app, due to company policy.

AlgorKorea's hearing aid firmware & app development technology created Personal Sound Amplifier (PSA) app that performs microphone & receiver calibration, includes all of the same four features as a smart hearing aid. The Personal Sound Amplifier app produces loud volume for profound hearing loss.

64 Channel Nonlinear precise Compression, Noise Reduction based on probabilistic analysis and Feedback Cancellation are the main features of AlgorKorea sophisticated Personal Sound Amplifier app. All of the three algorithms are implemented in real-time with high sound quality for hearing impairments.

The output audio level may be slightly different based on mobile phone’s volume settings, microphone and earphone/headset types.

Just make sure your Android version is 6.0 (API23) or higher.

title: WIDEX TONELINK
description:
Transform your smartphone into a multi-parameter remote control of your hearing aids. No need to carry a separate remote control device or to touch your hearing aids. Simply and discreetly adjust the key parameters of your hearing aid without the need of Bluetooth.
With the  TONELINK app you can easily:
    *Change programs
    *Adjust volume
    *Mute and unmute your hearing aid
    *Change directional focus to aid listening

How the  TONELINK app works
The  TONELINK app uses your phone's speaker to transmit acoustic control signals for the hearing aids. You have to pair your hearing aids with your phone the first time you use the app. Just follow the steps, and please note that you might need to adjust your phone volume for the app to work.
To ensure correct and safe operations:
    *This app is made for people with compatible WIDEX hearing aids fitted by a hearing care professional.
    *The sounds played by the phone may be audible by you and other people. The sound might be perceived as annoying by some people.
    *You can adjust the volume of these sounds by adjusting your phone volume to a level that is not annoyingly high and not too low for the hearing aids to pick up.
    *Do not use the app while the phone is directly by your or another person’s ears.
    *Do not use the app while connected to an external audio source.
    *This App is not tested on animals. Stop using the app if you notice any annoyed behavior from your pets when using it.

The  TONELINK app is compatible with the following WIDEX hearing aids:
    *WIDEX Evoke

WIDEX is continually listing more compatible devices. Please visit our website https://global.widex.com/en/support/tonelink-hearing-aid-app/compatibility
 for the latest devices we support.

title: MFA Hearing Test
description:
"MFA Hearing Test" uses UnlimiterHear's MFA Inside technology, a hearing detection algorithm, so you can quickly know your personal hearing status. Users with iPhone or iPad with headphone can take the hearing test. Individual test results can be uploaded to the cloud server, and the hearing arguments can be downloaded from the cloud and to the MFA assisted listening devices, and become secondary personal hearing device.

MFA hearing test is only a informational purposes only and is not intended to replace professional hearing test. Test results can not be used as a diagnosis.  If you want to like to know more about your hearing, you should visit a qualified and licensed hearing professional.

Features:
- Hearing test
- Support storing more than one hearing test results
- Support uploading information to cloud service

title: swissHear III
description:
In March 2020 we have published swissHear III with support for USB-C and Bluetooth. Much work has been done to increase the quality and usability of the application:

- BioAid configuration has been further improved
- Support for Android 10
- Fixed the problems with settings management
- Increased sound quality (less noise)
- Support for 3rd party modules
- Support for raw sound source on most phones
- USB-Headphones can be used
- Bluetooth-Headphones are now recognized

swissHear is a scientific hearing aid created by professional software engineers in cooperation with academic R&D teams. swissHear helps in many situations: at home watching TV, at work, in restaurants, movie theaters, concert halls or discussing with friends. swissHear uses the microphones and earphones of your smartphone. Low voices will be amplified, loud noises in your surroundings will be softened; just like a healthy ear. Using a novel technology, swissHear brings back sound to your life.

Fitting a hearing aid is not like buying glasses. Your hearing has decreased slowly over a long time and your brain was able to compensate. You only start noticing that you have a hearing problem, when your brain is at it's wits' end. Using a hearing aid will make noises explode in your head, because all compensation mechanisms are set to maximum. Please give your brain a few weeks time to recalibrate it's audio system...

Start your daily training in a simple situation with only one person talking in a low voice. Increase complexity slowly to avoid frustration.

There is no hearing aid on the market that will allow you to follow a group discussions in a loud restaurant. But in this kind of environment it is possible to put your device in front of your partner and hear his voice using the 'Basic Amplifier' module of swissHear.

swissHear will ask for some permissions that are needed to recognise incoming phone calls, save settings, update modules from the Internet and use the audio system of your phone or tablet.
descriptionHTML:
In March 2020 we have published swissHear III with support for USB-C and Bluetooth. Much work has been done to increase the quality and usability of the application:

- BioAid configuration has been further improved
- Support for Android 10
- Fixed the problems with settings management
- Increased sound quality (less noise)
- Support for 3rd party modules
- Support for raw sound source on most phones
- USB-Headphones can be used
- Bluetooth-Headphones are now recognized

title: Hearing Hunt
description:
Welcome to Hearing Hunt, a fun word search game for everyone. Listen to the word clues, play against time, and earn stars while enjoying themes related to the ocean, a movie theater, an airport, and more. This game offers three (3) difficulty levels while testing your ability to beat the clock. Designed to work with your hearing aid device, Hearing Hunt creates a unique auditory experience while combining the best of word searching. 

Main features:
-	Easy to play with a colorful, modern look
-	Exercise your brain and your hearing 
-	Learn valuable insights with “Did you know?” hearing facts 
-	Advance to new levels by collecting stars
-	Win coins with each word found, and use them for hints or advancing to a new level
-	Word searches are randomized every time you play 
-	Pair with any Bluetooth® enabled device
-	Members who sign up can earn daily coin prizes to use within the game 
-	More themes are coming soon

How to play:
-	Choose your difficulty level—easy, medium, or hard
-	Listen to the word clues 
-	Swipe your finger up, down, left, right, or diagonally to find each hidden word 
-	Find the hidden words before time runs out to earn stars and move within themes

Although the audible clues can be heard without the use of a hearing aid, Hearing Hunt works best when paired via Bluetooth to your hearing device.

The Bluetooth® word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by Bluetooth SIG, Inc.

title: Widex BEYOND
description:
BEYOND APP

The BEYOND app from Widex allows hearing aid users to connect to their BEYOND hearing aid, and control hearing aid functions. With a customizable interface, users can insert their own images and make adjustments to the sound in personalized programs.

With the BEYOND app you can:
• Adjust hearing aid volume and mute hearing aids
• Adjust directional focus to aid listening
• Create personal programs with different names, your own pictures and sound adjustments
• Choose favorite programs to appear on the front page
• Add locations to programs for automatic selection when in specific locations
• Adjust the sound equalization in up to three bands, or choose from sound pre-sets
• Access help in using the app, connecting and troubleshooting
• Locate your hearing aids if lost

WIDEX BEYOND and the WIDEX BEYOND APP are compatible with the following devices:
• Google Pixel
• Google Pixel XL
• HTC 10
• LG Nexus 5X 
• Moto g5
• Moto X Force
• Moto Z Play
• Samsung Galaxy® A5
• Samsung Galaxy® Note 4
• Samsung Galaxy® Note 5
• Samsung Galaxy® J5
• Samsung Galaxy® S6
• Samsung Galaxy® S6 Edge
• Samsung Galaxy® S7
• Samsung Galaxy® S7 Edge
• Samsung Galaxy® S8
• Samsung Galaxy® S8+
• Sony Xperia XZ
Widex is continually listing more compatible Android devices.

WIDEX BEYOND and the WIDEX BEYOND APP are optimized for Android devices running Android OS version 6.0 – Marshmallow or later versions.

Please consult the BEYOND website for up-to-date compatibility information:
https://global.widex.com/support/beyond-support

Product number: 5 300 0009 001
Version: 1.2.1

comments: If you want hearing aids that amplifies background volume really well and drowns out the conversation of someone beside you, then this one is for you. The last adjustment on the right for clarity does absolutely nothing. These aides are a complete waste of your money. And there seems to be very little concern by anyone to help improve the issues. Calling Widex help line is a complete waste of time and effort.
If only the telephone input to the hearing aid was available to Android phones it would be 5 stars.

Widex is deceiving Android users into thinking streaming will work with devices listed. I have Galaxy S7 and I was told a year ago, that they are working on it to stream Nothing yet, they are ignoring the Android users Almost 3 years now and no Android streaming, for a European company you're ignoring a large sector of the market

I set my "favorite" setting as both ears, the low, middle, and high all the all the way up because, by default, these things barely help. If I accidentally hit a button on them or get done listening to something through them, they refer back to their worthless "normal" setting. No! Go back to how I see it! I shouldn't have to open this stupid app! Also, it really pisses me off that I have to buy a comdex because this medical device has exclusivity with Apple! Widex, how greedy. Shame on you!

These hearing aids get the job done but the Bluetooth compatibility is extremely frustrating. I cannot take my hearing aids on and off all day to use my Bluetooth piece. My rep (San Francisco Hearing and Speech Center) told me android would become available. Its been over a year and nothing. The app is useful if you want to adjust audio settings. I uninstalled it because I never use it. Please work to get Android users Bluetooth compatibility. I believe $6,000+ is a high price to pay!

title: hlCorr: Слуховой аппарат - корректор / Hearing aid
description:
Приложение hlCorr (Hearing Loss Corrector) – бесплатное программное обеспечение, использующее современные методы обработки звука для компенсации слуховых потерь пользователя, от лёгкой степени, до тяжёлой.

	Описание:
Приложение, в режиме реального времени получает сигнал от микрофона, модифицирует его в соответствии с персональными настройками и воспроизводит изменённый сигнал через проводные наушники или гарнитуру (наушники с микрофоном), компенсируя этим слуховые потери пользователя.

Коррекция звука происходит в два этапа:
•	на первом этапе происходит динамическая компрессия звукового сигнала  (динамическое усиление или подавление уровня сигнала в соответствии с текущей акустической обстановкой);
•	на втором этапе применяется индивидуальный раздельный для правого и левого уха корректирующий фильтр, построенный на основании данных аудиограммы пользователя.

Для улучшения качества звука, в приложении реализован автоматический контроль коэффициента усиления и контроль наличия акустической обратной связи в звуковом тракте.

Минимально возможная временная задержка между входным и выходным звуковым сигналом обеспечивается тем, что вычислительное ядро приложения разработано на низкоуровневых языках программирования с применением оптимизированных алгоритмов обработки и передачи данных.

	Особенности:
Язык интерфейса приложения: русский и английский, устанавливается автоматически, в зависимости от настроек системы.

Рабочий режим приложения возможен только при подключении к Android - устройству проводной гарнитуры или наушников.

Все персональные настройки пользователя сохраняются в локальных профилях устройства.

Профиль представляет собой структуру данных, в которой определены настройки усилителя, заданы аудиограммы для левого и правого уха, тип корректирующего фильтра и дополнительные возможности по управлению качеством звука.

Приложение даёт возможность получить советы по его использованию, отследить соотношение спектров сигналов, отправить приватное сообщение разработчику.

	Преимущества:
Приложение может выполняться как в активном, так и в фоновом режиме.

При работе в фоновом режиме, приложение не производит лишних вычислений, поэтому его энергопотребление в этом случае минимизировано.

Переключение между профилями, например, при смене акустической обстановки, может производиться пользователем без останова рабочего режима.

Дополнительно имеется возможность автоматического запуска рабочего режима, сразу при присоединении наушников или гарнитуры.

Корректор звука предоставляет возможность управления соотношением «задержка/качество» посредством выбора количества точек БПФ.

Аудиограмма пользователя может быть создана в приложении путём тестирования слуха, так и записана на основании специализированных диагностических данных имеющихся у пользователя.

Панель настройки аудиограммы соответствует виду диагностической карты, принятому в сурдологии РФ.

Настройка параметров компрессии звука для его соответствия текущей акустической обстановке возможна в рабочем режиме. При этом процесс настройки будет визуальным.

При подключении проводного устройства, приложение автоматически определит его тип.

При использовании проводной гарнитуры, дополнительно появятся следующие возможности:
•	выбор источника звука: микрофон устройства или гарнитуры;
•	управление режимом работы: включение и выключение рабочего режима.

hlCorr имеет минимальный размер для скачивания и развертывания среди подобных приложений.

	Предупреждения:
Корректор слуха не является полноценной заменой слухового аппарата!

Корректор слуха не является медицинским программным обеспечением и не имеет соответствующей сертификации!

Оценка степени потери слуха в данном приложении является ориентировочной и не заменяет полноценной диагностики у специалиста!

Ответственность за использование данного приложения целиком и полностью несёт пользователь!

Разработчик предоставляет программное обеспечение в доступной для скачивания версии.

title: Lexie
description: Customize your Lexie hearing aid with the Lexie app that allows you to do a hearing check and program your Lexie hearing aids according to the results. Set up your hearing aids with step-by-step instructions and easily change settings on your hearing aids through the app. Speak to an expert through video and voice calling directly from the app, or browse the Help section for more information about your Lexie hearing aids. Earn Lexie Rewards points by completing easy activities and simply wearing your hearing aids. Redeem your Lexie Rewards points for batteries and other hearing aid consumables.

What’s new:
The Lexie Shop is now available! Purchase hearing aid batteries and accessories with your Lexie Rewards points or your credit card.

Need to replace a hearing aid with another? No problem! The ability to replace hearing aids seamlessly in the app is now available.

Improvements:
You spoke, we heard you! We’ve added the ability to redo the hearing check after setup. Access this in the Device Settings section of the app in Hearing Check Results.

Minor UI and Animation fixes
comments: Great App. Easy to navigate and I love the ideal that you can adjust your hearing aids without touching them. No one knows that you are wearing Hearing aids. And the Lexie Hearing aids are Fantastic.
I can't get the hearing aids to adjust and the app says hearing test failed reset then kicks the app off.

Could not pair any hearing aids. Tried for hours to no avail and customer support is non existent at this juncture. So no stars would be better because I have no app to control aids They might as well be hearing amplifiers at this point.
Love the app it's easy and simple to use!!

title: Hearing age meter
description:
Hearing age meter
Apps that can measure your age through hearing tests


You can test your hearing age anytime, anywhere.
People say that as you get older, you can not get higher frequencies (higher tones).
You can test your hearing to see what frequencies you can hear and test whether your hearing is younger than your age.

[ How to use ]
- There are various sounds that can only be heard at certain ages, and sounds that only animals can hear.
- Select the sound you want and hold the play button to sustain the sound.
- If you hear the sound, your hearing age is younger than the age shown on the screen!


Download it right now and test out who has more young hearing with your friends.


-authority

soundtruckapp@gmail.com

title: Super Hearing Oreo 8.1+ (Amplifier Equalizer PSAP)
description:
Test using 'Hearing Aid for Oreo 8.1 Free' before purchase:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.stereomatch.hearing.aid.oreo.demo

Hearing Aid for Oreo uses audio capabilities of Android Oreo 8.1 to deliver lowest-latency, fastest-response Hearing Aid app on Google Play!

- Use headset or device microphones
- Listen on earphones or device earpiece/speakers

- Uses Oreo low latency audio for a practically usable Hearing Aid app!
- Runs in background, even with screen off!
- Tested: 10 hour continuous use on single battery charge (Nexus 4 - Oreo 8.1)

- Easy swiping between Volume, Equalizer and Settings screens
- Use Volume screen for overall volume setting
- Boost Hi-Band on Equalizer to compensate for age-related hearing loss
- Use Settings screen to choose which microphone and speaker to use.

- TalkBack friendly for blind users


DISCLAIMER:  Not a medical device.  Get hearing tested, and use devices prescribed by professionals.  Try this app to explore how apps can improve speech comprehension.

When you first use the app, be careful not to increase volume too high.  Volume can be adjusted using your Android volume buttons.  But if you don't want to change your Android volume levels, you should use the Volume screen to set overall volume depending on the environment you are in, and use the Equalizer screen to customize for each ear.


Age-related hearing loss

Age-related hearing loss usually affects the high frequency range of hearing.  Hearing aid devices can compensate for this by increasing the volume on the Hi-Band.  This can improve comprehension of fricative sounds like 't' and 'sh' ('show' and 'sow' or 'table' and 'cable' are often confused, if you have age-related hearing loss).

However, hearing loss may not always be at the high-frequency end, and may affect younger people as well.  Which is why testing is important, to figure out which frequency bands require boosting to compensate for the specific hearing loss in each ear.  The Hearing Aid device is then programmed to boost the frequency bands which require compensation.

This app provides a simple 3-band Equalizer.  Since it only has 3 volume settings to adjust, it may be easier for users to judge which settings work better for them.  Usually for age-related hearing loss, you will improve comprehension by boosting the Hi-Band on the Equalizer.  Other users may prefer other settings.


Earphones/headset, Lapel mic, or device microphone

Use earphones or headset for best results.  In a pinch, you can use the Android device's built-in earpiece to listen, while using the same device's built-in microphone - however, this approach will lead to feedback at higher volumes (the device microphone will hear the output of the device's earpiece or speaker, which is a feedback loop, which creates an unpleasant whine sound).  If you use an external lapel microphone, then you can use the built-in earphones on device to listen.

It is best to use earphones to listen, while using the device microphones to record.  Or use a lapel microphone, or USB microphone for better quality.  Whichever configuration you choose, test for latency - some combinations give lower latency (better) than others.  Usually this will give the lowest latency: using a headset (with built-in mic) or plugging a Y-splitter into the android earphone jack, and plugging in separate earphone and separate microphone into the Y-splitter.

Bluetooth headsets can be used, but usually have much higher latencies (bluetooth latency is high on android), so may be more confusing to use.


Low latency / Fast response (Oreo Audio)

This app makes use of the audio improvements in Android Oreo.

If you like the low latency quality of the app, please support by purchasing the app.

If you paid for the app, but are not satisfied, please click Menu - Contact to e-mail us for a refund.  Or e-mail us at: amazingaudiomp3recorder AT stereomatch.com

title: hearWHO Pro
description:
It is important that people check their hearing  from time to time, especially those who are at a higher risk of hearing loss such as adults above 50 years, those working in noisy places, those listening to music at high volumes for long periods of time and those experiencing ear problems.

The hearWHOpro app is an easy-to-use application that can be used by health workers to check the hearing of people in their communities. It is based on a validated digits-in-noise technology. The app allows health workers to check and record people’s hearing scores. The scores can be shared with the individuals or their doctors. Those with low scores have to be referred for a proper hearing testing. If hearing loss is identified, the person should be referred to a specialist.
Identifying and addressing hearing loss early is essential to ensure that people do not suffer its adverse impact.

Want to connect with hearWHOpro:

Check out our website: https://www.who.int
Like and Follow us on Facebook: https://web.facebook.com/WHO/
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/WHO

Limitations:

The accuracy of the test results will depend on the type of headphones  used, as well as the ambient noise level. The results we provide are intended as a first step in testing  hearing. Please always seek advice from a medical professional. 

Disclaimer:

1.       If your result from using hearWHOpro was not favourable, we strongly recommend you  obtain a complete hearing evaluation by a certified service provider / medical professional to determine your exact hearing status.
2.       Even if your results are in the positive range but you have concerns about your hearing, we encourage you to seek a complete hearing evaluation performed by a certified service provider / medical professional.
3.       Whilst the test has a reasonable degree of accuracy, it is only intended as a screening test, with a small proportion of cases that may be incorrectly classified.
4.       The WHO and hearX Group will not be held responsible or liable for any results that are incorrect or for your use of the application.
5.       hearWHO is only intended for use by persons 16 years of age and above. The test is not intended to be used for children and will not provide reliable results in such cases.
6.       A visit to a certified service provider can assist in differentiating between different types of hearing problems.
7.       Hearing loss may be caused by obstruction of the outer ear canal from wax, fluid or changes in the structure or function of the middle ear system, and changes in function of the nervous system.
8.       Some of these hearing problems can be treated whilst others may be permanent and may need assistive devices.
9.   	It is important to consult with a certified service provider early; all forms of hearing loss may become more serious is they are left unaddressed.

title: Nucleus Smart
description:
With the Cochlear™ Nucleus® Smart App you can control your Nucleus 7 Sound Processor directly from your compatible mobile device for a personalised hearing experience.

With the Nucleus Smart App, you can:
- Change programs on your Nucleus 7 Sound Processor and activate Cochlear True Wireless™ streaming
- Activate audio streaming on compatible Android devices (see Compatibility section below)
- Adjust the volume, treble/bass and sensitivity settings (if enabled by your healthcare professional) on your Nucleus 7 Sound Processor
- Adjust the volume of your Cochlear True Wireless™ devices
- Locate your lost Nucleus 7 Sound Processor
- View Nucleus 7 Sound Processor status and battery level
- Track time in spent in speech and number of coil offs

Note: To access the complete functionality of the Nucleus Smart App you will need a Cochlear Account, or you can try the app in Demo Mode.
To use the Nucleus Smart App, you first need to pair your Nucleus 7 Sound Processor with a compatible mobile device. See in-app instructions or visit our support page www.nucleussmartapp.com/android/pair.

Compatibility: To use the Nucleus Smart App for Android, your device will need to run Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or later and support Bluetooth 4.0 and later. Audio streaming is only available on Android devices where the device manufacturer has enabled Audio Streaming for Hearing Aids (ASHA) technology. For a list of verified devices or to learn more about devices that support audio streaming visit https://www.cochlear.com/compatibility.

Note: Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life. The Nucleus Smart App only uses your GPS when it detects your Nucleus 7 Sound Processor has been lost or turned off, and does not constantly track your location.
Android, Google Play and the Google Play logo are trademarks of Google LLC.

If you like using the app, please give us a quick rating and review. We love to hear your feedback.
Thanks for using Nucleus Smart.
comments: This app has no reason to be cloud based. And now it's been offline for 3 days. Can't watch TV, can't use the phone, literally ruining my life because some clever guy thought it a good idea to lock the app into a cloud account. Even when it works it regularly logs me out and when we go abroad with no internet it's useless and for the sole reason that they wanted to lock me into their "cloud". Rediculous. Makes me so mad!

The app has been down since Tuesday and I've been told you're 'working on it' but this is now a significant amount of time. I can't stream and have since struggled with phone calls unable to do so. My remote has never been used so isn't an option and unlikely to be up to date for use. This has made the last few days quite difficult with no known duration of the app being unavailable.

Not operational, maybe you should be HoH (Hard of Hearing) to test this before making it official, it's was good till the moment it's permanently disconnected, tried force stopping, reinstalling none work, but when I reinstalled and attempt to relogin, it tells me that it has maintance? Wish I know that before I uninstalled it... Not happy how not operational you guy work on this, do better.

Connected to Nokia 5.3 works only intermittently. Mostly saying your device is not connected. This never happened on my iPhone which is not in use. Please cohlear you need to make this work. As lots of us have Android phones and getting apple is expensive. Please help us by making this app work. Thanks.

The app is good and can connect no problem but there only one problem is that no audio streaming. It says it cannot be connect to my moblie. I got Android samsung A50 won't connect audio streaming while my girlfriend got samsung A70 and work great on it. What is the difference between these 2 phone. Would give a 5 star if have audio streaming working.

title: Clear AMP Pro - Personal Sound Amplifier
description:
[WARNING !]
This app can be used for free for 3 days after the first subscription. You are not charged during the free trial period.

If it’s less than 48 hours since you bought a subscription, you can request a refund through Google Play.
A refund is not possible 48 hours after purchasing a subscription, due to company policy.
When you cancel a subscription you’ll still be able to use your subscription for the time you’ve already paid.

This app is optimized for Android version 8.1 (API 27) and higher versions. It may work in some phones with lower android version. Please make sure it works on your phone during the trial period. 
If it does not work properly in versions below Android 8.1, selecting 'Normal' instead of the default 'Low Latency' in [Detail Settings> Advanced option> Performance] may work.

On Android versions lower than 8.1, [Settings > Advanced option > Audio API] option is automatically selected as 'OpenSL ES'. The things to remember in 'OpenSL ES' mode are as follows:
-When 'OpenSL ES' is selected as 'Audio API', it is recommended to use earphones with no built-in microphone or Bluetooth earphones/headsets.
-When 'OpenSL ES' is selected as 'Audio API', if the earphone with a built-in microphone is used, the microphone of the earphone is used.

If the subscription is cancelled during the trial period you will not be charged.

If you use a sound amplifier without a doctor's prescription, your hearing can get worse.
Be sure to plug-in your earphone or pair your bluetooth headset with your mobile phone before starting the app.

This app is easier to use than other apps.

It is a 64-channel personal sound amplifier app that minimizes the delay between external sound input and amplified sound heard through earphones using the latest technology.

AlgorKorea's hearing aid firmware & app development technology created Personal Sound Amplifier (PSA) app that performs microphone & receiver calibration, includes all of the same four features as a smart hearing aid. The Personal Sound Amplifier app produces loud volume for profound hearing loss.

64 Channel Nonlinear precise Compression, Noise Reduction based on probabilistic analysis and Feedback Cancellation are the main features of AlgorKorea sophisticated Personal Sound Amplifier app. All of the three algorithms are implemented in real-time with high sound quality for hearing impairments.

The output audio level may be slightly different based on mobile phone’s volume settings, microphone and earphone/headset types.

Just make sure your Android version is 8.1 (API 27) or higher.

This app can be used for free for 3 days after purchase, and if you subscribe, you can continue to use the advanced voice amplifier function even after this period.

The subscription policy is as follows:

- If you do not cancel your regular payment at least 24 hours before the end of the subscription period, it will renew automatically.

- After subscribing, you can manage your subscription history and cancel your subscription from the Subscriptions option in the Play Store menu.

- The remaining validity period after subscription cannot be canceled.

- Subscription options are monthly subscription and annual subscription.

title: HANSATON stream remote
description:
The HANSATON stream remote App lets you control your hearing aids remotely from your smartphone.  

Use the app to:  
- Control volume
- Change programs
- Mute and unmute
- Adjust equalizer settings*
- Adjust the balance between background noise and the streamed signal when listening to streamed Bluetooth audio* or watching television in the TV Connector program (requires optional TV Connector accessory)
- Adjust the noise level in a tinnitus program
- Access status information such as battery state of charge and wearing time

The stream remote App is compatible with HANSATON hearing aids with Bluetooth connectivity, including: 
jam XC Pro R312 M
jazz XC Pro 312 Dir W
AQ sound XC Pro R
AQ sound XC Pro RT
AQ jam XC Pro R
sound XC Pro R312
AQ sound XC R
AQ jam XC R
sound XC R312
sound SHD stream S312

*The equalizer works on EXCITE Pro (XC Pro) hearing instruments only.
Smartphone compatibility: 

If you want to check if your smartphone is compatible, please visit our compatibility checker:  
https://www.hansaton.de/en/e/products/support/kompatibilitaet-excite/

title: Axil Hearing Test
description:
Take an online hearing test and learn more about hearing and discover if you might have a hearing loss. It is a useful and convenient tool to determine if you should seek further advice from a hearing care specialist.

Instructions
-------------------
1. Begin test in a quiet room without distractions
2. Plug in Earphones or Headphones to take your test (REQUIRED- Test tones will not work otherwise)
3. Turn your volume to 60% of its range (estimate if needed)
4. Press “START TEST” button to begin
5. The test will start on the left ear, then automatically switch to the right ear
6. Once complete, the test will show your results and you can download a copy
7. Click refresh or back arrow to restart the test.

Note: This is for presentation purposes only. This is not a clinic-based hearing test.
descriptionHTML:
Take an online hearing test and learn more about hearing and discover if you might have a hearing loss. It is a useful and convenient tool to determine if you should seek further advice from a hearing care specialist.

Instructions
-------------------
1. Begin test in a quiet room without distractions
2. Plug in Earphones or Headphones to take your test (REQUIRED- Test tones will not work otherwise)
3. Turn your volume to 60% of its range (estimate if needed)
4. Press “START TEST” button to begin
5. The test will start on the left ear, then automatically switch to the right ear
6. Once complete, the test will show your results and you can download a copy
7. Click refresh or back arrow to restart the test.

Note: This is for presentation purposes only. This is not a clinic-based hearing test.
summary: Check your hearing with the free online hearing test from Axil.

title: Tunity : Hear any muted TV
description:
JOIN TUNITY PRO TO SKIP ALL THE ADS - try it now and get one week free! After your free trial is over, you can upgrade to Tunity Pro and enjoy Tunity completely ad-free for $2.99/month. 

Awesome, new feature - QUICK TUNE: Listen to a previously scanned channel without having to rescan! Easily switch between channels and listen to multiple TV screens. 

With Tunity, you can tune in wherever you go! TUNITY is a FREE app that allows you to hear any muted, live TV audio directly on your mobile device. Simply scan the TV, let Tunity locate the channel and stream the audio through your headphones or bluetooth speaker.

Where Should I Use Tunity?
To put it simply—ANYWHERE!

AT HOME - At home with others reading, sleeping or working and don’t want to bother them with the TV audio? Use Tunity!

BARS - Next time you're at a sports bar, hear all the action from the game YOU want to hear!

GYMS - Tune in to any TV and move freely about the gym without disconnecting!

UNIVERSITIES – If your roommate is asleep or studying, Tunity lets you watch TV without disturbing them!

WAITING AREAS, AIRPORTS, HOSPITALS - Don’t stare at a muted TV when you can pass the time by fully tuning in to whatever it is you’re watching!

HARD OF HEARING - Those with a hearing impairment can listen to the TV at a volume that works best for them, without affecting anyone else in the room!

Don't just take our word for it:

Ryan Hoover - Founder, Product Hunt: "Really clever. This would be a great companion at the gym to listen to muted TV's in front of rows of elliptical machines"

CNET: "Tunity streams TV audio to your smartphone…and it's darn cool…the app has the potential to be a huge hit"

title: Hearing Sound
description:
Hearing Sound is part of an app series covering the ear for youth and health fair audiences. Join Harry Hearing as he shows key concepts of hearing sounds.

 •  Designed for an interactive teaching environment, the app is perfect as a “show and tell” teaching aid.
 •  Key concepts are displayed as both animations, interactive still images and a “Drag n Drop” sounds dB identification screen.
 •  All animation and still images can be zoomed, panned and sketched on.
 •  Example of use would be to project the app to a TV while the teacher narrates the story of Harry Hearing’s journey through the sounds of the ear.
 •  Throughout the session, the teacher can highlight significant concepts by drawing directly on the animations and still images as they play or are stopped on a key frame.
 •  Included is a youth audience health fair script and teaching station example - look for it under the help icon.
 •  The app loop feature allows the content to be looped through automatically for standalone uses such as museum displays, unattended health fair stations and clinic education.

Hearing Sound app makes teaching hearing sounds easy and fun. Get the app today!

title: Voli 🎧 Volume limiter for Kids' safe hearing
description:
We have 3 kids. When they all play Tablet we feel like in the middle of a fair.

Is this familiar? 

Headphones to the rescue?

But if they produce over 85 dB they will harm your kids' hearing!

Special headphones for kids?
Wired headphones for kids may not always meet the limit and their wireless counterparts are expensive and they emit EM radiation.

Use "Voli" instead!

Get $1 headphones and cap your kids tablet volume with "Voli".

Test your setup decibels!

We tested "Voli" to be under 85 dB on devices around. But we recommend you borrow a decibel meter to check your setup before using with your kids.

Attribution:
The featured graphics and in-app tutorial is based on the kids avatar vector graphics pack from https://www.svgrepo.com/vectors/kids-avatars/. Many thanks..

title: Tunefork Demo - Hearing Test & Audio Adjustment
description:
TuneFork is audio personalization software that delivers the optimal hearing experience, improving quality of life for people with hearing loss and elders.
Hearing is an individual experience. Each of us has unique hearing earprints. This is why no one sound system is perfect for everyone. When you listen to unbalanced audio, you will always miss something. In some cases, you may even cause damage to your hearing. 
The TuneFork app allows you to take a hearing test when and where is most convenient to you. You could take the test in your living room, without going anywhere, and discover your unique earprint. The test is simple yet accurate, following the same protocols as a clinical hearing test that would usually only be done in special booths in hearing centers.
After taking the test, the result - your earprint - is converted by a sophisticated algorithm into an audio filter adjusted to meet your hearing needs. The app provides you with a demonstration of our audio personalization technology by playing an example of an adjusted audio file so you can experience the best sound you've ever had. 
About the test:
- Should take 6-7 minutes
- Tests both ears to fully determine your earprint
- Clinically tested in laboratory conditions and regular home environments
The technology behind the app was developed by the TuneFork team with the support of Gal Hearing Systems. We guarantee that this is the most accurate self-test out there.
We are working hard to improve the test and the adjustment algorithm to bring new optimal and exciting hearing experience to everyone everywhere.
Please share your feedback with us: customerservice@tunefork.co.il

title: COM-DEX
description:
The COM-DEX app from Widex allows hearing aid users to remotely control their hearing aids via the COM-DEX hands-free streamer. COM-DEX streams high-quality sound to Widex hearing aids from mobile phones and from a connected COM-DEX Remote Mic.

With the COM-DEX App you can:
    • Adjust volume settings, change programs or alter sound levels of Widex hearing aids via the COM-DEX
    • Choose the directional focus of your hearing aids
    • See COM-DEX and COM-DEX Remote Mic battery status
    • COM-DEX Remote Mic controls: Pause/start stream, adjust microphone gain, surroundings on/off while streaming from microphone 
    • Boost the volume of streamed sound in settings menu
    • Swipe screen support added (change active screen by swiping left/right) 
    • COM-DEX and COM-DEX Remote Mic Connection Guide
    • Learn how to adjust sound, programs and sound direction with Usage Guides
    • Learn basic hearing aid maintenance with instructional videos
    • Locate nearest hearing care professional with the handy shop finder
    • Use the mirror to help placement of hearing aids

If your current COM-DEX has firmware older than version 1.3.0 (e.g. 1.2.0 or 1.0.10):
Please consult your dispenser for firmware upgrade if you want to optimize your experience with
COM-DEX Remote Mic support or have access to the new features mentioned in “What’s new in Version 1.3.0”.

To verify your current firmware version on COM-DEX:
When the App is connected to your COM-DEX, the firmware version can be seen in menu More| Help | App and device information -> COM-DEX firmware version: x.x.xx
descriptionHTML:
The COM-DEX app from Widex allows hearing aid users to remotely control their hearing aids via the COM-DEX hands-free streamer. COM-DEX streams high-quality sound to Widex hearing aids from mobile phones and from a connected COM-DEX Remote Mic.

With the COM-DEX App you can:
• Adjust volume settings, change programs or alter sound levels of Widex hearing aids via the COM-DEX
• Choose the directional focus of your hearing aids
• See COM-DEX and COM-DEX Remote Mic battery status
• COM-DEX Remote Mic controls: Pause/start stream, adjust microphone gain, surroundings on/off while streaming from microphone
• Boost the volume of streamed sound in settings menu
• Swipe screen support added (change active screen by swiping left/right)
• COM-DEX and COM-DEX Remote Mic Connection Guide
• Learn how to adjust sound, programs and sound direction with Usage Guides
• Learn basic hearing aid maintenance with instructional videos
• Locate nearest hearing care professional with the handy shop finder
• Use the mirror to help placement of hearing aids

If your current COM-DEX has firmware older than version 1.3.0 (e.g. 1.2.0 or 1.0.10):
Please consult your dispenser for firmware upgrade if you want to optimize your experience with
COM-DEX Remote Mic support or have access to the new features mentioned in “What’s new in Version 1.3.0”.

To verify your current firmware version on COM-DEX:
When the App is connected to your COM-DEX, the firmware version can be seen in menu More| Help | App and device information -> COM-DEX firmware version: x.x.xx
summary: The Widex COM-DEX app allow users to control Widex hearing aids via COM-DEX.
recentChanges:
• New screen for control of COM-DEX Remote Mic if it is connected (require COM-DEX with firmware 1.3 or newer and a COM-DEX Remote Mic)
• Possible to boost the volume of streamed sound in settings menu (require COM-DEX with firmware 1.3 or newer)
• Swipe screen support added (change active screen by swiping left/right)
• Leave demo mode more intuitive and easy to located (tap red banner in top of screen)
• Minor bug fixes
comments: I have to use this app to use my COMDEX device. The app is minimal and easy to use. But, there are glitches. Connection issues and worst still, developers seem to have abandoned the app as the last update was some 2-3 years ago, despite the app needing much improvement

Utter rubbish. If... If, it decides to connect, then its great. But that is one chance in five! They sell you the comdex receiver for ￡170 knowing it rarely works with thier App. Absolutely scandalous!!!
Not updated.. drops bluetooth. Very poor longevity. Had to replace at least 3 times due to technical issues

This app is totally useless! So far not impressed. Same complaint as many others. App does not keep settings while changing screens on your phone. My phones Bluetooth stays connected but app does not keep settings. Bringing these back ASAP! It's a shame because I like the hearing aids but your software is useless. Apparently they blame the phones instead of their own inability to be compatible. Why stay in business then? Fix the app or go away!

I've used this app for over a year, when it connects and works it's great. However that's when it connects. There is no rhyme or reason to when or why it connects / disconnects. Every morning the equipment connects fine via bluetooth, however when I launch the comdex app, things disconnect and if I'm lucky incan get it to reconnect. Most days it doesn't like today.... I reboot my phone reboot all devices and still won't connect. But it might tomorrow. It's such an asset when it works

title: WHHIP - Hearing Health Primer
description:
An informational tool to help Warfighters take their hearing health into their own hands.  The app combines text with contextual demonstrations to provide knowledge and understanding of the dangers of auditory injury and what life could be like if proper precautions are not taken.  The Warfighter can experience hearing loss and tinnitus through simulations before a permanent and progressive disability is acquired.  When questions arise as to how well hearing protection devices (HPDs) are fitting, the HPD Check feature will allow the Warfighter to compare his/her current fit of HPDs in his/her own ears to examples of good fitting devices.

Support was provided by the Office of Naval Research (ONR) Noise Induced Hearing Loss (NIHL) Program - http://www.onr.navy.mil
descriptionHTML:
An informational tool to help Warfighters take their hearing health into their own hands. The app combines text with contextual demonstrations to provide knowledge and understanding of the dangers of auditory injury and what life could be like if proper precautions are not taken. The Warfighter can experience hearing loss and tinnitus through simulations before a permanent and progressive disability is acquired. When questions arise as to how well hearing protection devices (HPDs) are fitting, the HPD Check feature will allow the Warfighter to compare his/her current fit of HPDs in his/her own ears to examples of good fitting devices.

Support was provided by the Office of Naval Research (ONR) Noise Induced Hearing Loss (NIHL) Program - http://www.onr.navy.mil
summary: Warfighter's Hearing Health Instructional Primer
recentChanges: Includes a typo fix from Dec 2017

title: UrbanDenoiser Player, Volume Booster, Bass Booster
description:
Do you feel discomfort of the ambient noise when your favorite music plays in your headphones? Do you have to take out the headset or switch off the sound in order to hear what you were asked about? UrbanDenoiser player solves these problems in no time.

UrbanDenoiser Player is a convenient and beautiful music player, with a noise reduction mode, unique mode of sound improvement (based on your hearing test), mode which allows you to hear surrounding sounds without stopping the music and a volume booster, bass booster mode . And all of it is totally free! 

FEATURES:

- Forget the noise: noise compensation mode with automatic volume adjustment and frequency masking – nothing will keep you from enjoying your favourite music. 

- Hear the important things: «Surrounding sound» mode for listening to media content and hearing the world around you.

- Natural sound: patented «natural sound restoring» algorithm for personalized sound processing according to your unique hearing profile.

- Volume amplifier, volume Booster: music amplifier restores natural hearing perception of the sound of music.

- Bass booster: powerful sound amplification, equalizer with different settings.

- Combine modes: combine processing modes - «Surrounding sound + Natural sound», «Denoiser + Natural sound» to suit the exact situation.

- Test your hearing: get the high quality of sound perfectly adapted to your hearing abilities.

Listen with pleasure!


CONTACT US:

If you encounter any problems, or have any questions, please contact us at: info@urbandenoiser.com

For latest news, please visit our websites:

comments: I can not see option to add songs to playlist. I can create playlist but cannot add any song to it, so I have to click per song. The noise cancelling seems to work, I am not very sure, while in earphone, I can still hear the noisy traffic, just a bit reduced. Also does not have option to use SD card as music source. Also not sure what normalizer exactly does, it seems to just increase the volume

Best app in my life for regulating earphones. As told denoiser wasn't working in closed environment it mute the audio playing on the device have to try on other regions. One minor drawback in wireless earphones is when disconnected, the audio resumes playing compared to other music players.
I can't play from Soundcloud. Every time i click "Soundcloud", the app crashes and i have to re-enter the app. Still doesnt work even after a few tries
Its really cool but if u could record it would be much better please let us be able to record while singing to the song

In my opinion mobile phones aren't very fast at processing sound from the microphone.Active noise cancellation is basically the mic sound but the phase is inverted. When these inverted waveforms are played over the environment noises they cancel each other out (0dB). This requires extremely low latency. A few microseconds of latency will cause an unsuccessful noise cancellation. That's why active noise cancellation can't be executed digitally. Op-amps can be used since they are analogue devices.

title: Zounds Hearing Aid Remote
description:
Select the models and enter the serial numbers of your Zounds hearing aids and this app will control them just like the hardware remote control does.
You can set the volume, treble, bass and mode of the hearing aids.
You can adjust the volume of the app and add a delay to the commands to give you time to lift the phone to your ear.  
Text optionally pops up to tell you which button you just pressed. 
You can choose to have it vibrate if you like, the "Quiet" button changes to "T-Coil" if your hearing aids have telecoils.  
Hold down a button to learn what it does.
descriptionHTML:

You can set the volume, treble, bass and mode of the hearing aids.
You can adjust the volume of the app and add a delay to the commands to give you time to lift the phone to your ear.

You can choose to have it vibrate if you like, the "Quiet" button changes to "T-Coil" if your hearing aids have telecoils.

summary: Control your Zounds Hearing Aids with your Android phone or tablet!
recentChanges: Added support for new models.
comments: Does not work reliably - sometimes yes, sometimes no.  Will discuss it with the Zounds dealer when I go in this week for my follow-up visit.  Remote device works reliably every time, but I hate to carry it around with me.

Cant get it to work at all. I uninstalled and then reinstalled, put in serial number again with no luck. Very disappointed that I will have to keep track of and carry the remote around. Not very discreet.
I'd give the App a zero star. Does not work with my Trezio 32. Developers seem to always be behind the power curve.
Changed the display to full screen, but cannot find a way to change it back to normal. How do you do that?

The left hearing aid works great.  The right I hear clicking but no beeps.  Tested using the remote on the right and it works fine.  ???  My fault, I entered an incorrect serial number for the right aid.  Works great so now I do not have to carry an extra device in my purse.  I love my new hearing aids.

title: Headfone - Indian Stories & Podcasts
description:
Headfone is a FREE social audio platform where you can record your voice, listen stories and share audios.

LISTENERS

★ Listen to your favorite internet radio stations.

★ Fill your travel with Hindi romantic stories, shayari and gazal.

★ Challenge yourself in night with Indian horror stories.

★ Let your child listen to kids stories.

★ Inspired yourself with the motivational quotes from leaders across the world.

★ Listen to Indian podcasts on politics, finance, news, business, startups, entrepreneurship & more to keep yourself updated with the current affairs.

★ Listen Bible, Gita, Quran & more to follow the path of spirituality.


CREATORS

★ Record your voice to share your stories, shayari, poetry, jokes, music or whatever you want to.

★ Record with background music as per the mood of the content. 

★ Create your own podcast to distribute pre-recorded content. Please write an email to headfone.org@gmail.com or visit our website http://www.headfone.co.in .


FEATURES

★ Take your favorite audios offline to listen them anytime from anywhere.

★ Follow your friends to know what they are up to. 

★ Subscribe to your favorite podcast and get notified about any update.

★ Share your favorite audios with your friends.

title: Absolute Ear - Diagnostics
description:
* An efficient way to check your hearing
* Ears screening, level of abstraction, hearing age
* Useful daily tips to protect your health

Usually, damages to hearing and hearing loss occur gradually. It's always better to be concerned about your hearing in advance. Use Absolute Ear tools to check whether you have some problems or not in order to prevent any disorders. Absolute Ear allows to make a comprehensive analysis of your hearing by using several simple tests.

√ DIAGNOSTICS:
- Hearing screening for each ear. Listen to the sounds of different range.
- Level of abstraction. Check if you can hear a particular sound among other noisy tones.
- Accurate test to define your "hearing age"

√ STATISTICS:
- Check the history diagram and statistics to compare the results

√ HEALTH ADVICE:
- Useful tips to maintain your hearing

Remember that in the dynamic modern life (rock concerts, powerful music players and other temptations) it's very important to take good care of your hearing.

title: Sonic SoundLink 2
description:
The Sonic SoundLink 2 app works with all Sonic wireless hearing aids with 2.4 GHz technology.

The Sonic SoundLink 2 app enables you to control your hearing aids, choose what you want to hear, and adjust the sound.

The app offers a “Find my hearing aid” search feature, links to user instructions, and low battery notification.

The Sonic SoundLink 2 app is also used to connect users to the Sonic service on IFTTT.

Other features:
- Select from which of your TV-Adapters you want to stream the signal to your hearing aids 
- Support for remote/partner microphone via SoundClip-A
- Advice on coping with hearing loss
- Connect your hearing aids to other devices and web services via Sonic IFTTT service.
- Individual volume Left & Right
- Control of tinnitus relief sounds (if supported by hearing aid)

For more information, you can access instructions on how to use this app in the application settings.

We recommend the following devices with Android 8.0 or later.

summary: SoundLink 2 app enables you to control your Sonic wireless hearing aids
recentChanges:
The Sonic SoundLink2 app has been updated!
We’ve listened to your feedback and added new features, including:
• In case of pairing to several TV-Adapters selection from which to stream
• Use of Apple ID to login to IFTTT services.
• New Sonic IFTTT service.
• Small improvements and bug fixes.

We hope that you will like the changes. Thank you for using our app!
comments: This is my updated review 7/31/2020. I have increased a star. The app is user friendly and easy to use. It is so nice to be able to use my aids as buds. I like the drop down menu to change volume/mode of hearing instead of having to go into the app itself when watching YouTube etc. It does not randomly disconnect as much anymore. I rarely use this app for calls. Battery life is not great 2 to 3 days but that changed after custom molds I was getting 4 to 5 days.

I'm new to hearing aids as of Friday 1/3/2020 and this app. This app was suggested by my audiologist. My list of cons are below for this app. 1. Burns my Motorola Z Force 3 battery down and fast. 2. Really, really wish that I could stream music and link phone calls and texts through my hearing aids which is a big plus with me. 3. Whatever Apple users can do on their cell phones, tablets and iPods, Android users should be able to do the same.

Sure would be nice to be able to answer phone calls through the app. Even just to hear the phone ring would be really nice without having to send more money on a device to connect the two together. When using to control the volume I have to remember if I want to adjust the right side to use the left side of the the phone. The left is the right and the right is the left.

Newest update has screwed everything up. Woke up the other day to find out there's a new update. Now my hearing aids spontaneously disconnect, won't reconnect, won't respond to volume control, and takes forever connect hearing aids when batteries aee changed. Why can't we do everything that Apple users can do. I want to stream music and answer phone calls through my hearing aids.

I would like to see additional functionality for android phones, linking cell phone for calls and streaming media. Similar to what is in the apple app. The functions I have now are pretty much limited to adjusting volume and battery level. UPDATE After using the app for a while, it needs a major overhaul. It randomly disconnects from one or both hearing aids, can't connect at all and I have to restart both aids and the app more than once to get the connection back.

title: Interton EasyHearing
description:
EasyHearing is a remote control for your Interton-supplied wireless hearing instruments and accessories.
 
Compatibility: Use the app with Interton-supplied wireless hearing instruments. Please note, that the Phone Clip 2 is required for use.
 
Functionality
Adjust volume level, mute and change programs on your hearing instruments. Adjust volume level on your audio streamers. Edit and personalize program names. Please go to Settings for a tutorial.
 
Important notice: Please make sure to turn off all touch/lock sounds and keyboard clicks on your mobile device as these may interfere with your use of the app.
 
Support
Link status: The Link control in the toolbar will indicate if your mobile device is not connected to the necessary hearing devices. For troubleshooting guidance on connection status, tap Link and follow the instructions.
 
Demo mode: To view a demonstration version of EasyHearing, go to Settings and enable Demo mode. This allows you to go through the functionality of the app without being connected to the Phone Clip 2 and wireless hearing instruments. In Demo mode, there is no communication between EasyHearing and other hearing devices.

title: ENTina - Visual Hearing Aid
description:
This App is meant for the hearing impaired & their loved ones. It's like having subtitles in a live conversation.

However, an app can never be as good as a human ear, so it is adviced to speak slowly, loudly, in a noise-free environment & only when the recording button is being displayed. 

It records continuously, but takes breaks when processing.

It takes time to get used to & requires practice...

title: Earfy: live captions for persons with hearing loss
description:
Persons with hearing loss communicate independently with the Earfy app for Android! The app converts speech to text in real time, so you can immediately read what’s being said. Captions appear continuously on screen; just like subtitles on television.

The app includes useful features such as:
- 40+ languages.
- Ongoing stream of captions; no need to continuously push a button.
- Optimized readability (colors, fonts, …).
- Mirrored text. Reader & speaker can both follow.
- Correction-button to mark wrongly captioned sentences.
- Speech quality indicator.
- Copy or email transcripts of conversations.
